title.narrative: Technical support of trained CSOs for the production in social media in Senegal

description.narrative: CSOs were mobilized in a social media for an awareness campaign at the occasion of International Women's Day, celebrated on July 31 every year. This campaign was undertaken with the support and coaching of bloggers.

Results - 20 content (including 10 infographics, 08 videos and 02 portraits) were produced by 8 young people from 8 during this campaign. These productions focused, as well as the position of women in rural areas, women's entrepreneurship in rural areas and victories achieved in promoting women's rights. - These publications generated more than 12,000 interactions, sparking more than 1,100 reactions from users. - Some debates organized in community radios, such as Radio Oxyjeunes, and relayed on Facebook were shared by the CSOs on their platform. So, interconnection links have been created between high schools and other project stakeholders, including CSOs and community radios
